member.name: T:Xtensive.Aspects.ImplementFactoryMethod
member.summary: Implements static factory method that calls the specified constructor found by its signature.
member.remarks: If you're really interested in actual behavior, we recommend you to study the decompiled MSIL code of class having this attribute applied using .NET Reflector.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Aspects.ImplementFactoryMethod.ParameterTypes
member.summary: Gets the protected constructor argument types.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Aspects.OverrideFieldNameAttribute
member.summary: Overrides field name for persistence purposes. Should not be applied in end-user code.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Aspects.OverrideFieldNameAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Aspects.ReplaceAutoProperty
member.summary: Replaces auto-property implementation to invocation of property get and set generic handlers.
member.remarks: If you're really interested in actual behavior, we recommend you to study the decompiled MSIL code of class having this attribute applied using .NET Reflector.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Aspects.ReplaceAutoProperty.HandlerMethodSuffix
member.summary: Gets the name suffix of handler methods.
member.remarks: If suffix is "Value", handler methods should be T GetValue<T>(string name) and void SetValue<T>(string name, T value).

member.name: T:Xtensive.Aspects.ImplementConstructor
member.summary: Implements protected constructor with a set of specified parameter types. Implemented constructor will call the constructor with the same set of arguments from the base type.
member.remarks: If you're really interested in actual behavior, we recommend you to study the decompiled MSIL code of class having this attribute applied using .NET Reflector.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Aspects.ImplementConstructor.ParameterTypes
member.summary: Gets the constructor parameter types.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Aspects.ImplementConstructorEpilogue
member.summary: Injects epilogue method calls into the constructor.
member.remarks: If you're really interested in actual behavior, we recommend you to study the decompiled MSIL code of class having this attribute applied using .NET Reflector.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Aspects.ImplementConstructorEpilogue.HandlerType
member.summary: Gets the type where epilogue method is declared.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Aspects.ImplementConstructorEpilogue.HandlerMethodName
member.summary: Gets the name of the epilogue method to call.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Aspects.ImplementConstructorEpilogue.ErrorHandlerMethodName
member.summary: Gets the name of the initialization error handler method to call.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Aspects.InfrastructureAttribute
member.summary: Marks a method or property as infrastructure method or property. No any aspects will be applied to it by default.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Aspects.InitializableAttribute
member.summary: Injects "initializable" aspect by modifying constructors so that methods with name and are invoked by each of them to ensure common post-construction initialization task is completed.
member.remarks: If you're really interested in actual behavior, we recommend you to study the decompiled MSIL code of class having this attribute applied using .NET Reflector.

member.name: T:Xtensive.Aspects.SuppressActivationAttribute
member.summary: Suppresses the activation of context of specified for the method it is applied on.

member.name: M:Xtensive.Aspects.SuppressActivationAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.param: Type of the context to suppress activation for.

member.name: P:Xtensive.Aspects.SuppressActivationAttribute.ContextType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the context to suppress activation for.
member.remarks: If is then context activation for all contexts must be suppressed.
